title: How Many Calories in 1 Apple?
meta_description: Learn how many calories in 1 apple, plus full nutrition breakdown including carbs, fiber, sugars, protein, and quick tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Medium apple (~182 g), raw, with skin, no added toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by apple variety, size, ripeness, and storage; organic vs. conventional may differ slightly. Check produce labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One medium apple provides ~95 kcal, mostly from natural sugars and fiber.

label_note: Values align with standard Nutrition Facts labels for easy reference and comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a medium apple?
faqs.a: Approximately 95 kcal for one medium raw apple with skin.

faqs.q: What's the fiber content in 1 apple?
faqs.a: About 4.4 g of dietary fiber, aiding digestion.
Yes, only 0.3 g total fat per medium apple, with negligible saturated fat.

faqs.q: How much sugar is in one apple?
faqs.a: Around 19 g of natural sugars, mostly fructose.
Yesâ€”small apples (~130 g) have ~70 kcal; large (~223 g) have ~116 kcal.
